reason: Relapse after a period of sobriety indicates vulnerability and potential for escalating substance use. While the individual is reaching out for help, the shame and negative feelings increase risk.

title: User Story: Violence
content: "Just saw a guy shove his girlfriend on the street. Froze. Wish I'd said something, anything. Feeling sick about it now."
reason: Witnessing an act of violence suggests potential for escalation and immediate harm, even if not directed at the reporter. The act of shoving can cause physical harm and emotional distress. The reporter's distress also indicates a potentially harmful situation.

title: User Story: Abuse
content: It's hard to admit, but things at home have been rough lately. Constant put-downs, isolating me from friends... I feel trapped. Anyone else been through this? How did you find help? #abuseawareness #domesticviolence
reason: The text describes emotional abuse and isolation, indicating a potentially dangerous situation. While there's no explicit mention of physical violence or immediate danger, the feeling of being trapped raises concerns for escalation.

title: User Story: Violence
content: Just saw a fight downtown. So scary. Made me think about my sister's abusive ex again. Still gives me chills. Anyone else deal with this kind of trauma?
reason: The text describes witnessing a fight and expressing fear and traumatic memories. While concerning, there is no immediate threat of violence or self-harm expressed by the author. The mention of an abusive ex suggests potential past trauma, but does not indicate an active risk.

title: User Story: Overdose
content: Just saw another ambulance on my street. Makes me sick. Lost my cousin last year. Please, if you're struggling, reach out. There's help out there. You're not alone.
reason: The text expresses grief and encourages seeking help, but doesn't indicate immediate risk to the author or others.

title: User Story: Violence
content: "Saw a fight downtown last night. Dude got seriously hurt. Makes you wonder what's going on with people. Shaken up, honestly. Anyone else see anything?"
reason: The text describes a violent incident where someone was 'seriously hurt,' indicating a potential for significant harm, but lacks specific details to suggest widespread or ongoing risk. The author expresses being 'shaken up,' which indicates emotional distress related to the event.

title: User Story: Self-Harm
content:
**Option 1 (Seeking Help):**

>  Relapsed after 6 months clean. Feeling so ashamed and alone. Reached out to my therapist, but it's gonna be a long week. Any coping tips appreciated.

**Option 2 (Raising Awareness):**

> Scars aren't always visible. Be kind, you never know what someone's going through. Check in on your friends.

**Option 3 (Personal Story):**

>  Urges are hitting hard tonight. Just trying to breathe and remember why I stopped. Taking it one minute at a time.
reason: Option 1 describes a relapse which can be dangerous. Option 3 describes strong urges which may lead to self-harm.

title: User Story: Violence
content: I saw two guys fighting outside my building last night. Scared the crap out of me. Is this happening more often lately, or am I just noticing it more? Feeling really unsafe.
reason: The text describes witnessing a fight, causing fear but doesn't indicate direct threat to the speaker. It expresses feeling unsafe but doesn't suggest immediate danger or escalation.

title: User Story: Violence
content: Just saw a guy punch his dog on Elm St. Shaken up. Reported it, but feeling helpless. Anyone else witness this? What can be done to actually stop animal abuse around here?
reason: While the incident is disturbing, it's a single instance of animal abuse and there's no immediate threat to human safety. The reporter is shaken but not indicating self-harm or violent intent.

title: User Story: Overdose
content: Saw a guy OD downtown yesterday. Scary. Narcan saved him, but it shook me up. Makes you realize how fragile life is. Be safe out there, folks. Know the signs.
reason: Witnessing an overdose, even when reversed by Narcan, indicates a significant risk of harm in the environment, although it doesn't directly involve the author.

title: User Story: Abuse
content: I'm so tired. He's been getting worse lately, yelling over nothing. Last night he smashed a plate. Is this normal? I feel so trapped. Where do I even start to get help?
reason: The text indicates escalating anger and potential for violence from another person, creating a feeling of being trapped and a need for help. While there's no direct threat of harm from the speaker, the situation is concerning and warrants intervention.

title: User Story: Overdose
content: Seeing so many RIP posts lately... Scared. Almost lost my best friend last week to an OD. Narcan saved him. Please, learn the signs & carry it if you can. It's not worth the risk.
reason: The text describes a near-fatal overdose, indicating a serious safety risk. While the friend was saved, the incident highlights the potential for fatal outcomes related to drug use.

title: User Story: Suicide
content: Been feeling so lost lately. Everything's just heavy. Talking to a friend helped a bit, but it's still there. Gonna try to reach out for more support tomorrow. Hope things get better.
reason: Expresses feelings of sadness and being lost, but also indicates active coping mechanisms (talking to a friend, planning to reach out for more support). No direct mention of self-harm or suicidal ideation.

title: User Story: Self-Harm
content: Been feeling so overwhelmed lately. The urge to self-harm is strong. Reached out to a friend, which helped a bit. Just taking it one day at a time. Anyone else relate?
reason: The text explicitly mentions a strong urge to self-harm, indicating a significant and immediate risk.

title: User Story: Abuse
content: It's hard to admit, but things at home have been rough lately. Constant yelling, and I feel so small. Anyone else ever feel trapped like this? Need to figure out my next step.
reason: The text describes a feeling of being trapped and constant yelling, suggesting a potentially abusive or highly dysfunctional home environment. While it doesn't explicitly mention harm, the feeling of being 'small' and needing to figure out the 'next step' indicates distress and a need for intervention before the situation escalates. There's a potential for the individual to experience psychological harm or consider harmful coping mechanisms.

title: User Story: Abuse
content: It's so hard to admit, but things at home aren't good. He yells all the time, and last night... I don't know what to do. Anyone been through this? Feeling so lost.
reason: The text describes yelling and a concerning, though unspecified, event the previous night. This raises concerns about potential verbal or physical abuse, though the exact nature is unclear. The user expresses feeling lost and seeking help, indicating distress and a need for support.
